text: I found him on the avenue. His identity with me was, as it were, outrageous. I said, "Who are you?" And he let me go, whispering the syllables: I shouted to him, distressed: "No! I'm Luis Vidales. I'm not going to be here. And he answered me with a great astonishment, saying, And who can contradict him? And I really had nothing to argue with him. Bells are ringing, 1926
title: El vecino de adentro
author: Luis Vidales
